topFlavours.name: Crispy tarantulas
topFlavours.description: Bizarrely, they became popular and are now served as a deep-fried snack throughout the country. Apparently they taste a bit like crab.

topFlavours.name: Century egg
topFlavours.description: The century eggs are covered in clay, ash and salt for months, by which time the yolk is dark green and stinks of sulphur. Mmmm!

topFlavours.name: Stargazey Pie
topFlavours.description: A pie with fish that stare at the sky: Stargazey originates from the Cornish village of Mousehole in England.

topFlavours.name: Huitlacoche
topFlavours.description: Corn smut is a fungus that turns normal corn kernels into tumour-like growths covered in blue-black spores.

topFlavours.name: Balut
topFlavours.description: This fertilised duck egg, with its partly developed embryo inside, is boiled alive and then eaten from the shell with salt, chilli and vinegar.
